intro: Microsciadium cuneifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microsciadium, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Microsciadium cuneifolium is often found in open, sunny areas and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
